The NL51RU is a device by the taiwanese OEM manufacturer Clevo. It is sold as System76 Pangolin, Tuxedo Aura 15. The hardware is configurable and includes an AMD Ryzen 5 4500U or AMD Ryzen 7 4700U, AMD radeon 6 core integrated graphics, up to 64GB RAM @3200MHz, SSD (SATA or NVMe), microSD card reader, 3g/LTE modem and a HDMI output.

sections.title: Firmware
sections.content: fwupd is supported. Testing showed System firmware and SSD firmware updateable.

sections.title: Webcam
sections.content: The webcam needs to be activated by pressing Fn+F10, otherwise device will not be available.

sections.title: Sound
sections.content: Sound mostly works out of the box, tested with ALSA and PulseAudio. Wrong sound card may be selected by default. Microphone seems to be working out of the box as well.

sections.title: Touchpad
sections.content: The touchpad works out of the box. Scrolling and multi finger touches work, as well as left/right clicks. Gestures seem to be working, tested with libinput-gesturesAUR.

sections.title: Wi-Fi
sections.content: Wi-Fi seems to work well. When tuxedo-drivers-dkmsAUR is installed, Fn+F11 toggles airplane mode.

sections.title: Function keys
sections.content:
Table content:
Key | Visible?1 | Marked?2 | Effect
Fn+F1 | Yes | Yes | XF86TouchpadToggle
Fn+F2 | No | Yes | Disables display
Fn+F3 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioMute
Fn+F5 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioLowerVolume
Fn+F6 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioRaiseVolume
Fn+F7 | Yes | Yes | Seems to have same effect as Super+p
Fn+F8 | Yes | Yes | XF86MonBrightnessDown
Fn+F9 | Yes | Yes | XF86MonBrightnessUp
Fn+F10 | No | Yes | Toggles webcam
Fn+F11 | No | Yes | Toggles airplane mode
Fn+F12 | No | Yes | Suspend device
Fn+` | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioStop
Fn+Numpad/ | No | Yes | Switch keyboard backlight color
Fn+Numpad* | No | Yes | Toggle keyboard backlight
Fn+Numpad- | No | Yes | Decrease keyboard backlight brightness
Fn+Numpad+ | No | Yes | Increase keyboard backlight brightness
Fn+1 | No | No | Seems to toggle fan at max speed

1. The key is visible to xev and similar tools
1. The physical key has a symbol on it, which describes its function

To make use of some of the Fn keys (Airplane mode, keyboard backlight), kernel module needs to be added. Installing tuxedo-drivers-dkmsAUR from the AUR was tested and enables these keys after reboot.
